public class ValueResolver
extends java.lang.Object

Nested Class Summary
static class ValueResolver.ResolverType
          Generic resolver class, where we can register new value resolvers that transform existing input into a different format.

static java.lang.String resolveCalendar(java.util.Calendar cal, java.lang.String pattern)
          Converts a given Calendar object into a human-readable format.
static java.lang.String resolveSysDate(java.lang.String sysdate)
          Converts a system date like '2011-03-31T19:54:33' to user-readable date.
static java.lang.String resolveValues(java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Value> values, ValueResolver.ResolverType resolver)
          Resolve a list of values using the specified resolver type Cases: - Specified resolver supports list of values => use the resolver - Specified resolver does not support list of values => handle the first item with resolve(Value, ResolverType), ignore rest - List of values is empty or null => resolve as UNDEFINED - List of values has size one => use resolve()

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Method Detail

resolve

public static java.lang.String resolve(org.openrdf.model.Value value,
                                       ValueResolver.ResolverType resolver)
Resolves a value string using a specified resolver (as string). Can be extended on demand by new resolvers. Should not return null.

Parameters:
value -
resolver -
Returns:

resolveValues

public static java.lang.String resolveValues(java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Value> values,
                                             ValueResolver.ResolverType resolver)
Resolve a list of values using the specified resolver type Cases: - Specified resolver supports list of values => use the resolver - Specified resolver does not support list of values => handle the first item with resolve(Value, ResolverType), ignore rest - List of values is empty or null => resolve as UNDEFINED - List of values has size one => use resolve()

Parameters:
values -
resolver -
Returns:

resolveSysDate

public static java.lang.String resolveSysDate(java.lang.String sysdate)
Converts a system date like '2011-03-31T19:54:33' to user-readable date. If the input is not a valid system date, the value is returned as is.

Parameters:
sysdate -
Returns:

resolveCalendar

public static java.lang.String resolveCalendar(java.util.Calendar cal,
                                               java.lang.String pattern)
Converts a given Calendar object into a human-readable format.

Parameters:
cal - The Calendar object
pattern - The format pattern used for SimpleDateFormat
Returns:
A human-readable String
